keyword: how many calories in two scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Two Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in two scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Two Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with minimal butter or oil (about 1 tsp total), no milk, cheese, or additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and recipe variations. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: Two large scrambled eggs provide about 182 kcal and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories per scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal fat.

faqs.q: What is the protein in two scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 14 g total fat for two eggs, mostly from the yolks and added cooking fat.

faqs.q: How does adding cheese affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adding 1 oz cheese to two eggs increases calories by about 100-110 kcal.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added fats; boiled eggs are about 78 kcal each, while scrambled are 91 kcal each.
